biography.short: Internationally renowned baroque recorder player, recognized for his virtuosity and authentic interpretation of works from the repertoire.
biography.content1: Guillaume Beaulieu began learning the recorder at the age of ten at the Massy music school, located in the south suburb of Paris, before joining Jean-Pierre Nicolas's class at the CRD Paris-Saclay, graduating with unanimous high honors. He then integrated Pierre Hamon's class at the CNSMD of Lyon, where he received his master's degree in 2015 with highest distinction.
biography.content2: His passion for early music led him to explore basso continuo, furthering his education by studying harpsichord with MichÃ¨le DÃ©vÃ©ritÃ© at the CRD Paris-Saclay.
biography.content3: His versatility has allowed him to perform both in France and internationally (Brazil, Japan, Poland, the Netherlands, Belgium, Israelâ€¦) with various ensembles: Ensemble Pygmalion, Les Nouveaux CaractÃ¨res, Correspondances, Consort Brouillamini, and Barrocada Orchestra.
biography.content4: Guillaume Beaulieu is a laureate of several international soloist awards: 1<sup>st</sup> prize at the Tel Aviv International Solo Recorder Competition in 2020, 2<sup>nd</sup> prize at the Moeck / SRP Solo Recorder Competition in 2017, 3<sup>rd</sup> prize at the New York International Competition in 2019 (Golden Classical Music Awards), and 3<sup>rd</sup> prize at the Nordhorn Competition. Additionally, with his recorder ensemble, Consort Brouillamini, he won 1<sup>st</sup> prize at the International Early Music Days Competition in Vanves in 2016, as well as the audience prize for the MusÃ©e en Musique season in Grenoble in 2015.
biography.content5: Guillaume is highly passionated by his instrument and he intervenes regularly in masterclasses and teaches recorder at the School of the Arts in Marcoussis as well at the Chevilly-Larue Conservatory, where he also is the director.

info.title: About
info.content1: This website is published and hosted in France by the law 1901 organization Messe Basse Production (RNA number W911005952, Sermaise â€“ France). The source code of this website is accessible on this repository GitHub and is distributed under the open source license GPL-3.0.
info.content2: The photographic, textual and audio-visual contents present on this website are protected; any reuse outside of this context requires prior authorization to be obtained from contact@messe-basse-production.com and each reuse of content must be accompanied by a mention of the author of said content.
info.content3: In order to measure the audience of this website and in accordance with the recommendations of the CNIL regarding GDPR, this site uses an analytics tool, Matomo which respects the privacy of its users. The cookies used to measure the audience do not require consent. Messe Basse Production guarantees that no personal data is collected and that no data has the right to be used for commercial purposes.
